title: Talking About Hobbies
description: Practice speaking about your hobbies and free time activities.

sentences.text: What do you like to do in your free time?
sentences.translation: 여가 시간에 뭐 하는 것을 좋아하세요?
sentences.tips: 'free time'을 한 덩어리로 발음하고, 끝을 올려서 의문문 억양을 살리세요.

sentences.text: My hobby is playing the guitar.
I enjoy reading books and watching movies.
sentences.translation: 저는 책 읽기와 영화 보기를 즐겨요.

sentences.text: I want to learn how to cook.
sentences.tips: 'want to'를 'wanna'처럼 자연스럽게 연결해서 발음할 수 있어요.

sentences.text: I've been doing photography for two years.
sentences.tips: 'I've been'을 연결하고, 'photography'의 강세는 두 번째 음절: pho-TOG-ra-phy.

sentences.text: Would you like to join our book club?
sentences.tips: 'Would you like to'를 부드럽게 연결하고, 친근하게 권유하는 톤으로 말하세요.

sentences.text: I practice every day to improve my skills.
It's a great way to relax after work.
I'm thinking about joining a yoga class.

sentences.tips: 'recommendations'는 긴 단어예요. 강세는 네 번째 음절: rec-om-men-DA-tions.

sentences.text: I'm a beginner, but I'm improving quickly.
This hobby helps me reduce stress.
sentences.translation: 이 취미는 스트레스를 줄이는 데 도움이 돼요.

lines.text: What do you like to do in your free time?
I enjoy photography. How about you?
I like playing sports, especially basketball.
That sounds fun! How often do you play?
Twice a week. I'm thinking about joining a team.
You should! It's a great way to meet people.

items: Did you pronounce hobby-related vocabulary clearly?
Did you use rising intonation for questions?
Did you speak at a natural pace?
Did you speak without long pauses?
Did you practice the dialogue smoothly?
Did you use gerunds correctly after 'enjoy'?
Did you use infinitives correctly after 'want'?
Did you follow the pronunciation tips?
Could a listener understand your hobby description?
Did you sound enthusiastic about your hobbies?
Did you record and compare all sentences?
